chinese.text: Your best mirror is someone more beautiful than you.

Who is not satisfied with himself will grow; who is not sure of his own correctness will learn many things.
Who rides a tiger cannot dismount.
Who teaches me for a day is my father for a lifetime.
Who tells me of my faults is my teacher; who tells me of my virtues does me harm.
You can hardly make a friend in a year, but you can easily offend one in an hour.
You can lean on a bamboo stick, but not on a rope.
You can live with tea and cold rice but not with cold words.
You can mirror something from other people; you can only give out that which is your own.
You can never be happy at the expense of the happiness of others.
You can't be the head of a family unless you show yourself both stupid and deaf.
You can't buy an inch of time with an inch of gold.
You can't catch a cub without going into the tiger's den.
You can't clap with one hand only.
You can't expect both ends of a sugar cane to be as sweet.
When men discuss the things which are to be, the rats laugh in the rafters.
When men speak of the future, the gods laugh.
When money is stolen you can only beat the dog.
When people are no longer afraid of death, there is no use threatening them with it?
When people only talk about things they understand then a great silence will descend upon the world.
When planning for a year, plant corn. When planning for a decade, plant trees. When planning for life, train and educate people.
When someone gives you a drop of water reward him with a never ending source.
When the boat reaches mid-stream, it is too late to stop the leak.
When the cat is gone, the mice come out to stretch.
When the deal is done, discuss it no more; it is difficult to collect dispersed water.
He has too many lice to feel an itch.
He hath lived ill that knows not how to die well.
He painted a tiger, but it turned out a dog.
He that has no money might as well be buried in a rice tub with his mouth sewn up.
He that has no silver in his purse, should have silver on his tongue.
He that has not bread to spare should not keep a dog.
He that is afraid to shake the dice will never throw a six.
He that is not eager to be pawed in cash is not a businessman.
He that once deceives is ever suspected.
He who always eats the roots of a plant is capable of any thing.
We are not so much concerned if you are slow as when you come to a halt.
We can move the entire mountain one piece at a time.
We can study until old age and still not finish.
We forget even incense in easy times; come hard times, we embrace the Buddha's feet.
We know the worth of water when the well is dry.
Weaklings never forgive their enemies.
Wealth and obscurity cannot equal poverty and fame.
Wealth is but dung, useful only when spread about.
Weaving a net is better than praying for fish at the edge of the water.
Wedlock is a padlock.
You never are so easily mistaken as when you think you know the way.
You think you lost your horse? Who knows, he may bring a whole herd back to you someday.
You think you've lost your horse? Who knows, he may bring a whole herd back to you someday.
You want no one to know it? Then don't do it.
You will never be punished for making people die of laughter.
You will never lose a battle if you know your own situation as well as that of the enemy.
You won't get much fat from a dry bone.
You won't help shoots grow by pulling them up higher.
You won't help the new plants grow by pulling them up higher.
Friendship between gentlemen appears indifferent but is pure like water.
From Nanking to Beijing, buyers are never as smart as the sellers.
From the lowly perspective of a dog's eyes, everyone looks short.
Fruits of the same tree have different tastes; children of the same mother have various qualities.
Full of courtesy, full of cunning.
Garden flowers larger, field flowers stronger.
Garlands are not for every brow.
Gems are polished by rubbing, just as men are made brilliant by trials.
Genius can be recognized by its childish simplicity.
Only fools seek credit from the achievements of their ancestors.
Only he that has traveled the road knows where the holes are deep.
Only one who can swallow an insult is a man.
Only the man who crosses the river at night knows the value of the light of day.
Only through the eyes of others can we really see our own faults.
Only when all contribute their firewood can they build up a strong fire.
Only your shadow knows your true height.
Opinions are like nails: the more often you hit them the deeper they penetrate.
Our enemies teach us life's most valuable lesson.
Our needs are few but our wants increase with our possessions.
Three times an early rise makes a whole day.
Throw in a rock as someone is drowning in the well.
Throw out a brick to attract a jade.
Thunder is louder than the little rain warrants.
Time and tide wait for no man.
Time is like a river - it flows by and doesn't return.
To attract good fortune, spend a new coin on an old friend, share an old pleasure with a new friend, and lift up the heart of a true friend by writing his name on the wings of a dragon.
To be able to curse once a day improves happiness and lengthens life.
To be for one day entirely at leisure is to be for one day an immortal.
To be human is easy, to be a human being is difficult.
When you want to test the depths of a stream, don't use both feet.
When your horse in on the brink of a precipice, it is too late to pull the reins.
When your horse is on the brink of a precipice it is too late to pull the reins.
When your neighbor walks through your orchard, the polite thing to do is to ignore it.
Whenever the water rises, the boat will rise too.
Whenever there is profit to be made then think of honesty.
Where a chest lieth open, a righteous man may sin.
Where there's a will to condemn there is also evidence.
Whether we walk quickly or slowly, the road remains the same.
Which cat does not gorge a mouse?
The wise man forgets insults as the ungrateful forget benefits.
The wise man learns more from his enemies than a fool does from his friends.
The wise man shapes himself to circumstances as water shapes itself to the vessel that contains it.
The wolf barks in vain at the moon.
The woman who deceives her husband makes her lover swear never to be unfaithful to her.
The woman who tells her age is either too young to have anything to lose or too old to have anything to gain.
The world is our house. Keep it clean.
The wound caused by a sword can eventually be healed; the hurt resulted from vicious remarks can never be undone.
The Yangtse never runs backwards; man recaptures not his youth.
The Yangtze never runs backwards; man recaptures not his youth.
Unplowed fields make hollow bellies; unread books make hollow minds.
Urge people to work, not to eat.
Use power to curb power.
Vicious as a tigress can be, she never eats her own cubs.
Victory has hundred fathers and defeat is an orphan.
Virtue becomes a wife; beauty becomes a concubine.
Virtue is not left to stand alone.
Virtue never dwells alone, it always has neighbors.
Virtue practiced to be seen is not real virtue; vice which fears to be seen is real vice.
When you cease to strive to understand, then you will know without understanding.
When you drink from the stream remember the spring.
When you drink water, remember where the mountain spring is.
When you fall into a pit, either you get out or die.
When you fall into a pit, you either die or get out.
When you have only two dollars left in the world, buy a loaf of bread with one, and a rose with the other.
When you have read a book for the first time, you get to know a friend; read it for a second time and you meet an old friend.
When you lift your hand to strike, you are three-tenths lower than your opponent.
When you say one thing, the clever person understands three.
Within the four seas all man are brethren.
Without rice, even the cleverest housewife cannot cook.
Without the aid of the divine, man cannot walk even an inch.
Women and fools never forgive.
Women are as beautiful as flowers when they are forty years old.
Women never praise without gossiping.
Words are mere bubbles of water, but deeds are drops of gold.
Words are sounds of the heart.
Words that come from the heart stay warm three winters long.
Would rather be a chicken's head than a phoenix's tail.
Well water is not an enemy of spring water.
What appears beautiful is not always good for you.
What first appears as a calamity may later bring good fortune.
What is fated to be yours will always return to you.
What is lighter than a feather? The wind. Lighter than the wind? The spirit. Lighter than the spirit? The woman. Lighter than the woman? Nothing at all.
What is not urgent must be done quickly in order to take care of the urgent things calmly.
What is told in the ear of a man is often heard a hundred miles away.
What is told into a man's ear is often heard a hundred miles away.
What is told into the ear of a man is often heard a hundred miles away.
What is whispered in your ear is often heard a hundred miles off.
The gift itself can be light while carrying a heavy message.
The gods cannot help those who do not seize opportunities.
The great scholar forgets about fame, the average scholar works for it, and the unworthy scholar steals it.
The great wall stands; the builder is gone.
The greater your troubles, the greater is your opportunity to show yourself a worthy person.
The greatest conqueror is he who overcomes the enemy without a blow.
The greatest virtue is like water; good for everything.
The guest who outstays his fellow guests loses his overcoat.
The happiest life ends before death.
To fall is not painful for those who fly low.
To feed the ambition in your heart is like carrying a tiger under your arm.
To find out about the road ahead, ask those coming back.
To forget one's ancestors is to be a brook without a source, a tree without a root.
To get through the hardest journey we need take only one step at a time, but we must keep on stepping.
To go beyond is as bad as to fall short.
To guess is cheap, to guess wrong is expensive.
To have beautiful servant girls is a threat to good marriages.
To have saved one human life is worth more than to build a pagoda with seven stories.
To know and know that you know, not to know and know that you don't know, that is to know.
No wise man takes responsibility for an eighteen-year-old daughter.
Nobility is what is earned by those who have no other earnings.
Nobody's family can hang out the sign, "Nothing the matter here.
Nobody's family can hang up the sign, 'nothing the matter here.'
Not only those who can talk the best tell you the most interesting things.
Not the fastest horse can catch a word spoken in anger.
Not wine . . . men intoxicate themselves; not vice . . . men entice themselves.
Notoriety travels farther away.
Wise men are never in a hurry.
With a frog in the well you don't talk about the ocean.
With happiness comes intelligence to the heart.
With money one may command devils; without it, one cannot even summon a man.
With money you are a dragon; with no money, a worm.
With money you can make the dead speak; without it you can't even keep the deaf quiet.
With money, a dragon -- without it, a worm.
With time and patience the mulberry leaf becomes a silk gown.
With true friends . . . even water drunk together is sweet enough.
With virtue you can't be entirely poor; without virtue you can't really be rich.
To tell only half the truth is to give life to a new lie.
To understand your parents' love you must raise children yourself.
To violate the law is the same crime in the emperor as in the subject.
Today's beneficiary is the incarnation of his preexisting well-doer; the fate of one's next existence lies in his existence today.
Too much politeness conceals deceit.
Too much spirit shows a lack of it.
Too often do we waste time chasing a gust of wind or grasping at shadows.
Transgressions should never be forgiven a third time.
Treat thoughts as guests and wishes as children.
Trees have already been made into a boat.
To know another is not to know that person's face, but to know that person's heart.
To know one's self is to know others, for heart can understand heart.
To learn about other people is science, to learn to know yourself is intelligence.
To learn what is good, a thousand days are not sufficient; to learn what is evil, an hour is too long.
To listen well is as powerful a means of influence as to talk well, and is as essential to all true conversation.
To make good conversation there are a thousand subjects, but there are still those who cannot meet a cripple without talking about feet.
A journey of a thousand li begins with a single step.
A picture is worth a thousand words.
chinese.description: Pictures convey emotions and messages better than written or spoken explanations

chinese.text: After all I have no nationality and am not anxious to claim any. Individuality is more than nationality.
Be not ashamed of mistakes and thus make them crimes.
He who counsels himself, counsels a fool.
I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.

If there is righteousness in the heart, there will be beauty in the character. If there is beauty in the character, there will be harmony in the home. If there is harmony in the home, there will be order in the nation. If there is order in the nation, there will be peace in the world.
If thy strength will serve, go forward in the ranks; if not, stand still.
If to-day will not, to-morrow may.
If two ride on a horse, one must ride behind.
It doesn't matter how slowly you go as long as you don't stop.
That which is benevolent is invincible.

The feeling of commiseration is the feeling of humanity; the feeling of shame and dislike is the beginning of righteousness; the feeling of deference and compliance is the beginning of propriety; and the feeling of right and wrong is the beginning of wisdom. Men have these Four Beginnings just as they have their four limbs.
Three things demonstrate a lack of filial piety.
Train equally the mind and body.
Using writings to form a community.
When a thing is done, advice comes too late.
Who depends on another man's table often dines late.
You are you and I am I.
To meet an old friend in a distant country is like the delight of rain after a long drought.
To mock your elders is to wreck the house where you have to stay tonight.
To open a book brings profit.
Other people are excited, as though they were a parade. I alone don’t care, I alone am expressionless like an infant before it can smile
No one can see their reflection in running water. It is only in still water that we can see.
To act sincerely with the insincere is dangerous.
In the end the treasure of life is missed by those who hold on, and gained by those who let go
No matter how much you try to hold on to something, it will all be gone
Tension is who you think you should be. Relaxation is who you are
Talk doesn’t cook rice

If there is light in the soul, there will be beauty in the person. If there is beauty in the person, there will be harmony in the house. If there is harmony in the house, there will be order in the nation. If there is order in the nation, there will be peace in the world
The best time to plant a tree is twenty years ago. The second best time is now.
If you want one year of prosperity, grow grain. If you want ten years of prosperity, grow trees. If you want one hundred years of prosperity, grow people.
Sow a thought, reap an action; sow an action, reap a habit; sow a habit, reap a character; sow a character, reap a destiny.
A person who says it cannot be done should not interrupt the man doing it.
A single conversation with a wise man is better than 10 years of study
Tell me and I’ll forget; show me and I may remember; involve me and I’ll understand
Do not confine your children to your own learning, for they were born in another time
Wise men may not be learned; learned men may not be wise
Be like the bamboo the higher you grow the deeper you bow
A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.
A single conversation across the table with a wise person is worth a months study of books.
If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape one hundred days of sorrow.
People who say it cannot be done should not interrupt those who are doing it.
Learning is a treasure that will follow its owner everywhere
Tension is who you think you should be. Relaxation is who you are.
The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now
Enjoy yourself. It’s later than you think
The gem cannot be polished without friction, nor man perfected without trials
One joy scatters a hundred griefs
Every smile makes you a day younger
Don’t fear moving forward slowly. Fear standing still
One generation plants the trees; another gets the shade
Sleep is the brother of death
Govern a family as you would cook a small fish – very gently
Do good, reap good; do evil, reap evil
There is only one pretty child in the world, and every mother has it
Teachers open the door, but you must enter by yourself
He who asks is a fool for five minutes, but he who does not ask remains a fool forever
Learning is like rowing upstream: not to advance is to drop back
A man who asks is a fool for five minutes. A man who never asks is a fool for life
When the winds of change blow, some people build walls and others build windmills
Two barrels of tears will not heal a bruise
If you must play, decide on three things at the start: the rules of the game, the stakes, and the quitting time
Reading ten thousand books is not as useful as traveling ten thousand miles
He who asks a question is a fool for five minutes; he who does not ask a question remains a fool forever
Be not afraid of growing slowly, be afraid of standing still
Great doubts, deep wisdom. Small doubts, little wisdom
When you go to buy, don't show your silver
If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow
One moment of patience may ward off great disaster. One moment of impatience may ruin a whole life
He who blames others has a long way to go on his journey. He who blames himself is halfway there. He who blames no one has arrived
The appearance of a disease is swift as an arrow; its disappearance slow, like a thread
A man grows most tired while standing still
When the heart is at ease, the body is healthy
Don’t listen to what they say, go see
Nature, time and patience are the three great physicians
A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song
Be the witness of your thoughts. You are what observes, not what you observe
If we are facing in the right direction, all we have to do is keep on walking
When the student is ready, the master appears
If a seed of a lettuce will not grow, we do not blame the lettuce. Instead, the fault lies with us for not having nourished the seed properly
The instant we feel anger we have already ceased striving for the truth, and have begun striving for ourselves
The greatest impurity is ignorance. Free yourself from it. Be pure
If you're poor, change and you'll succeed.
Big fish eat small fish.
It's better to be without a book than to believe a book entirely.
chinese.description: It is important to think critically rather than believe everything you read.

chinese.text: A single conversation with a wise man is worth a month’s study of books.
chinese.description: Wisdom is sometimes more important than knowledge.

chinese.text: If a son is uneducated, his dad is to blame.
chinese.description: Fathers are responsible for their children's education.

chinese.text: A jade stone is useless before it is processed; a man is good for nothing until he is educated.
chinese.description: Education is what turns people into productive human beings.

chinese.text: True knowledge is when one knows the limitations of one’s knowledge.
chinese.description: It is important to recognize the limits of your education.

chinese.text: Govern a family as you would cook a small fish—very gently.
chinese.description: Do not be harsh in how you treat your family.

chinese.text: To understand your parents love you must raise children yourself.
chinese.description: Only parents know what it is like to raise children.

chinese.text: A child’s life is like a piece of paper on which every person leaves a mark.
chinese.description: Children are very impressionable.

chinese.text: Giving your son a skill is better than giving him 1,000 pieces of gold.
chinese.description: It is better to support your child with education than money.

chinese.text: Once bitten by a snake, he/she is scared all his/her life at the mere sight of a rope.
chinese.description: Trauma causes people to fear things that they have no reason to fear.

chinese.text: With true friends, even water drunk together is sweet enough.
chinese.description: True friends only need each other's company to enjoy themselves.

chinese.text: If you want happiness for a lifetime; help someone else.
chinese.description: Happiness comes through helping others.

chinese.text: A smile will gain you 10 more years of life.
chinese.description: Staying positive will improve your health.

chinese.text: One joy scatters a hundred griefs.
chinese.description: It only takes a small amount of happiness to bring great relief.

chinese.text: We count our miseries carefully, and accept our blessings without much thought.
chinese.description: We often take our blessings for granted.

chinese.text: A dish of carrot hastily cooked may still have soil uncleaned off the vegetable.
chinese.description: Take your time and do things properly rather than rushing and making mistakes.

chinese.text: When the winds of change blow, some people build walls and others build windmills.
chinese.description: Personal challenges can be opportunities for growth.

chinese.text: The more you sweat in practice, the less you bleed in battle.
chinese.description: Preparing for challenges in advance will make it easier for you to meet them.

chinese.text: All things are difficult before they are easy.
chinese.description: Nothing is easy the first time you do it.

chinese.text: Bad things never walk alone.
chinese.description: Troubles always come with other troubles.

chinese.text: When you are poor, neighbors close by will not come; once you become rich, you'll be surprised by visits from (alleged) relatives afar.
chinese.description: When you have something people want, everyone will try to be your friend.

chinese.text: Behind an able man, there are always other able men.
chinese.description: No one accomplishes anything alone.

chinese.text: Three humble shoemakers brainstorming will make a great statesman.
chinese.description: Teamwork allows people to do much more than any one person could do on their own.

chinese.text: An inch of time is an inch of gold but you can't buy that inch of time with an inch of gold.
chinese.description: Time equals money but money does not equal time.

chinese.text: Age and time do not wait for people.
chinese.description: If you wait to get started, life will go on without you.

chinese.text: No one knows a son better than the father.
No shame in asking questions, even to people of lower status.
Abandon yesterday, tomorrow and today. Cross over to the farthest shore beyond life and death
‘Enough’ is a feast
When you have only two pennies left in the world, buy a loaf of bread with one, and a lily with the other
Tension is who you think you should be, relaxation is who you are
One happiness scatters a thousand sorrows
A wise man, recognizing that the world is but an illusion, does not act as if it is real, so he escapes the suffering
Life and death are one thread, the same line viewed from different sides
Music in the soul can be heard by the universe
A bad word whispered echoes a hundred miles.
Teach a man to fish.
chinese.description: This is a very well-known proverb, meaning that it’s much more effective to teach someone how to do something for themselves than to simply do it for them in the long-term.

chinese.text: One only learns from one’s mistakes.
chinese.description: This proverb is all about learning from your experiences or mistakes.

chinese.text: It’s better to make slow progress than no progress at all.
chinese.description: It reminds us to be patient and that some things take time, slow progress is still progress after all.

chinese.text: Opportunity knocks but once.
chinese.description: This proverb reminds us that we need to seize opportunities when they present themselves.

chinese.text: Learn to walk before you run.
chinese.description: Take things slowly; don’t try to stuff your face at the start.

chinese.text: The master leads you to the door, the rest is up to you.
chinese.description: The act itself is up to the individual

chinese.text: A careful foot can step anywhere.
A friend to everybody is a friend to nobody.
A good book is a good friend.
A good heart influences Heaven and Earth.
A good teacher. . . better than a barrowful of books.
A hundred foot bamboo can progress yet another step.
A king’s riches cannot buy an extra year.
A man who chases two rabbits catches neither.
A man without a smiling face must not open a shop.
A man’s conversation is the mirror of his thoughts.
A nation’s treasure is in its scholars.
A pure heart has few desires.
A sharp tongue or pen can kill without a knife.
A straight foot is not afraid of a crooked shoe.
A whitewashed crow soon shows black again
A wise man adapts himself to circumstances as water shapes itself according to the vessel that contains it.
After you is good manners.
All language is not in books, nor all thoughts in language.
An hour may destroy the work of a hundred years.
An inch of gold can’t buy an inch of time.
An inch of time is an inch of gold but you can’t buy that inch of time with an inch of gold.
Arrogance costs a fortune.
As tao raises a foot, the demon raises ten. [Where truth/tao is prominent, persecution arises.]
At birth we bring our nothing; at death we leave with the same.

Be careful what you water your dreams with. Water them with worry and fear and you will produce weeds that choke the life from your dream. Water them with optimism and solutions and you will cultivate success. Always be on the lookout for ways to turn a problem into an opportunity for success. Always be on the lookout for ways to nurture your dream.
Beat the drum inside the house to spare the neighbors.
Before telling secrets on the road, look in the bushes.
Before the thought has arisen, the gods know it.
Better lean and good than fat and evil.
Better to be without a book than to believe a book entirely.
Black cat or white cat: If it can catch mice, it’s a good cat.
Blame yourself as you blame others; forgive others as you forgive yourself.
By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
Cheat your conscience, and a whole life’s happiness is destroyed.
Choose a job you love and you will never have to work a day in your life.
Close to a blacksmith, learn to hammer out nails; close to a carpenter, learn how to use a saw.
Coming events cast their shadows before them.
Determination tempers the sword of your character.
Distance tests a horse’s strength. Time reveals a person’s character.
Divide an orange–it tastes just as good.
Do not afraid of moving slowly. Be afraid of standing still.
Do not impose others what yourself do not desire.
Do not remove a fly from your friend’s forehead with a hatchet.
Do not use a hatchet to remove a fly from your friend’s forehead.
Do not want others to know what you have done? Better not have done it anyways.
Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
Dogs have no prejudice against the poor.
Doing good gives the greatest happiness; study gives the greatest good.
Don’t fear the enemy that attacks you, but the fake friend that hugs you.
Don’t go thirty miles to sell firewood, or three hundred miles to purchase grain.
Don’t waste your hour–the sun sets soon.
Easier to rule a nation than a child.
Easy to open a shop, hard to keep it open.
Embrace every chance of laying up merit, and your daily wants will be regularly supplied.
Enjoy yourself. It’s later than you think.
Entire sincerity moves spiritual beings.
Everyone eats and drinks; yet only few appreciate the taste of food.
Forget the favors given; remember those received.
Give a man a fish, and he’ll eat for a day. Teach him how to fish and he’ll eat forever.
Give a man a fish, feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish, feed him for life.
Give me a fish and I eat for a day. Teach me to fish and I eat for a lifetime.
Give me liberty, or give me death!
Giving your son a skill is better than giving him one thousand pieces of gold.
Great doubts, deep wisdom. . . small doubts, little wisdom
Great profits, great risks.
Great truths cannot penetrate rustic ears.
Happiness is like a sunbeam, which the least shadow intercepts, while adversity is often as the rain of spring.
Have but few friends, though much acquaintance.
He prayed for rain and received fire instead.
He vainly lived among people; to no purpose he walked across the plain.
He who asks a question is a fool for five minutes he who does not ask a question remains a fool forever.
He who depends on himself will attain the greatest happiness.
He who has never been cheated cannot be a good businessman.
He who has seen little is astonished at much.
He who is foolish finds disaster.
He who returns from a journey is not the same as he who left.
He who stores up evil, although still living, is dead; he who stores up goodness, although dead, is still living.
He who waits for a roast duck to fly in his mouth must wait a very long time.
He will win who knows when to fight and when not to fight.
Heaven and Earth will not be angry with one who will correct his faults.
Heaven has a road, but no one travels it; Hell has no gate, but people bore into it.
Heaven knows and Earth knows—how can I alone know?
Heaven, having let me be born as a man, requires me to follow its doctrines.
His virtues exceed his talents–a superior man
Honest scales and full measure hurt no one
How can a tiger or leopard [i.e. a superior person] put up with the insults of a dog or sheep [i.e. a lesser person]?
I’d rather die for speaking out, than to live and be silent.
If a man keeps his mouth shut, his words become proverbial.
If for one day one does not meditate upon goodness, all [kinds of] wickedness will spring up of themselves.
If I am walking with two other men, each of them will serve as my teacher. I will pick out the good points of the one and imitate them, and the bad points of the other and correct them in myself.
If one plants in the springtime, one will harvest in the fall.
If the first words fail, ten thousand will then not avail
If the mirror is highly polished, the dust will not stain it; if the heart is enlightened, evil desires will not arise in it. – Chinese
If there were no gods or demons in the world, man would do all kinds of things [Without the fear of the gods, man would be uncontrollable].
If you always give You will always have.
If you are rich, you speak the truth if you are poor, your words are but lies.
If you are standing upright, don’t worry if your shadow is crooked.
If you ask for directions rudely, you might end up many miles from your destination.
If you bow at all bow low.
If you don’t scale the mountain, you can’t view the plain.
If you don’t want anyone to know it, don’t do it.
If you hurry through long days, you will hurry through short years.
If you plan for one year, plant rice. If you plan for ten years, plant trees, If you  plan for 100 years, educate mankind.
If you see in your wine the reflection of a person not in your range of vision, don’t drink it.
If you shoot for the stars and hit the moon, it’s OK. But you’ve got to shoot for something. A lot of people don’t even shoot.
If you survived a storm, you won’t be bothered by the rain.
If you suspect a man, don’t employ him, and if you employ him, don’t suspect him.
If you think in terms of a year, plant a seed; if in terms of ten years, plant trees; if in terms of 100 years, teach the people.
If you want 1 year of prosperity, grow grain. If you want 10 years of prosperity, grow trees. If you want 100 years of prosperity, grow people.

If you want happiness for an hour — take a nap. If you want happiness for a day — go fishing. If you want happiness for a month — get married. If you want happiness for a year — inherit a fortune. If you want happiness for a lifetime — help someone else.
If you want no one to know, don’t do it.
If you want your dinner, don’t insult the cook.
If you wrangle over things of little importance, then you lose the great Tao.

If your fate is not propitious, you should nevertheless cultivate virtue. The sleeping dragon will someday ascend to Heaven. [If your time of fortune has not come, cultivate virtue and wait for your time of fortune].
If your mind is strong, all difficult things will become easy. If your mind is weak, all easy things will become difficult.
If your principles are not good, you sin against Heaven and Earth; if your words and actions are good, you leave an example for sons and grandsons.
If your strength is small, don’t carry heavy burdens. If your words are worthless, don’t give advice.
In a flood of words, surely some mistakes.
In a group of many words, there is bound to be a mistake.
In bed be wife and husband, in the hall each other’s honored guest.
In the midst of great joy, do not promise to give a man anything. In the midst of great anger, do not answer a man’s letter.
It is after a hundred battles that heroes are produced.
It is easy to open a store
chinese.category: the hard part is keeping it open.

chinese.text: It is for me to put forth the utmost effort; it rests with Heaven to give success to my plans.
Joy is not a horse. You cannot harness it.
Keep a green tree in your heart and perhaps a singing bird will come.
Laws control the lesser man. Right conduct controls the greater one.
Let each one go his own Tao.
Let people despise me [as they like]—but if Heaven does not spurn me, then loss is gain.
Let us fulfill our own parts, and await the will of Heaven.
Let’s put our heads together for the benefit of all.
Life is finite, while knowledge is infinite.
Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
Like Weather, one’s fortune may change by the evening.
Limitations are but boundaries in our minds.
Logic takes you from A to B, but imagination takes you everywhere.
Love is not about possession, it’s all about appreciation.
Love your neighbors, but don’t pull down the fence.
Make My Home Everywhere within the Four Seas. The World Is My Home.
Man combs his hair every morning. Why not his heart?
Man reasons in a thousand ways; the spirits only in [the right] one.
Man who say it cannot be done should not interrupt man doing it.
Many a good face under a ragged hat.
May your every wish be granted.
Men trip not on mountains they trip on molehills.
My life–a candle in the wind. . . frost on the leaves.
Near putrid fish you’ll stink; near the epidendrum you’ll be fragrant [One takes the color and odor of one’s company.]
Near vermilion one gets stained pink; near ink one gets stained black.
Neither fortunes nor flowers last forever.
Never hesitate to ask a lesser person.
No guests at home, no hosts abroad.
No horse can wear two saddles.
Nobody should neglect to cultivate secret virtues.
Not wine…men intoxicate themselves; Not vice…men entice themselves.
Nothing is softer or more flexible than water, yet nothing can resist it.
Nowadays, people are shortsighted—they regard the outward appearance as important, but not the virtue.
Nurture the plant one year–ten days of flowers.
O eggs, don’t fight with rocks.
Of all female qualities, a warm heart is the most valuable.
One dog barks at something, the rest bark at him.
One generation plants the trees; another gets the shade.
One man spreads a false report, and a hundred report it as truth.
One should be just as careful in choosing one’s pleasures as in avoiding calamities.
One sincere thought can influence Heaven and Earth.
Opportunities don’t just happen, you create them.
Opportunity knocks at the door only once.
Past scholars studied to improve themselves; Today’s scholars study to impress others.
People doing the same things might have different motives.
Practice no vice because it’s trivial… Neglect no virtue because it’s so.
Putting aside virtuous deeds and not doing them—this may be styled "self-robbery."
Quickly do works of repentance, and you will be upon the conscious shore. Butchers drop your knives, and become Buddhas as a result.
Respond intelligently even to unintelligent treatment.
Ripe fruit falls by itself, but it doesn’t fall in your mouth.
Rise and fall of a nation rests with every one of its citizens.
Seeing it once is better than being told 100 times.
Set yourself as the standard.
Show compassion to others’ misfortunes, and rejoice in their excellences.
Silence is a source of great strength.
Simple to open a shop; another thing to keep it open.
Slow work–fine work.
Some people want to be praised for the rest of their lives for what they did well for one day.
Some study shows the need for more.
Stare at the profit and step in the pitfall.
Stout men, not stout walls, make the stout city.
Take a second look… It costs you nothing.
Take merit and [use it to] mend sin.
Tao does not act in vain.
Tell me and I’ll forget. Show me and I may remember. Involves me and I’ll understand.
Tension is who you think you should be, relaxation is who you are.
The beginning of wisdom is to call things by their right names.
The best fighter is never angry.
The Chun Tzu conquers himself; the Hsiao Jen is envious and overbearing.
The door of good works is difficult to open—but when opened, it is difficult to close.
The evil sea [i.e. the world] is vast. Turn the head [i.e. repent] and you are at the shore.
The glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time you fall.
The gods are in his skill.
The hearts of the people are the only legitimate foundations of the Empire.
The journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
The judge with seven reasons states only one in court.
The melon seller does not announce, "Bitter melons."
The people sitting in the free theatre seats are the first ones to boo.
The person who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
The person who says something is impossible should not interrupt the person who is doing it.
The pine stays green in winter…Wisdom in hardship.
The ripest fruit falls by itself.
The smallest desire to do good is—though not seen by man—certainly known to Heaven.
The swiftest horse can’t overtake a word once spoken.
The temptation to quit will be greatest just before you are about to succeed.
The tongue like a sharp knife… Kills without drawing blood.
The way to close the mouth of a slanderer is to treat him with contempt.
The wise adapt themselves to circumstances, as water molds itself to the pitcher.
The wise listens to her mind, the foolish to the mob.
There are two perfect men one dead, and the other unborn.
There is a road to Paradise, but you choose not to go. There is no door to Hell, and yet you force your way to woe. [Used of one unwilling do right]
There is many a good man to be found under a shabby hat.
Those who do not read are no better off than those who cannot.
Those who have free seats at a play hiss first.
Three feet of ice were not frozen in a day.
Tile tossed over the wall. . . who knows where it will fall?
Time is money, and it is difficult for one to use money to get time.
To be heard afar, bang your gong on a hilltop
To believe in one’s dreams is to spend all of one’s life asleep.
To believe in Tao is easy; to keep Tao is difficult.
To build it took one hundred years; to destroy it one day.
To do evil is to transgress the laws of Heaven.
To forget one’s ancestor’s is to be a brook without a source, a tree without root.
To have principles first have courage.
To know and know that you know, not to know and know that you don’t know, that is to know.
To know another is not to know that person’s face, but to know that person’s heart.
To know others, know yourself first.
To know the road ahead, ask those returning.
To make a man of yourself you must toil.
To stop drinking, study a drunkard while you are sober.
To succeed, consult three old people.
Touch black paint, have black fingers.
Unless we change direction, we are likely to wind up where we are headed.
Watch over workers at their labors, not their meals.
Watching chess games in silence. . .a superior person.
We can study until old age. . . and still not finish.
We should feel sorrow, but not sink under its oppression.
What you cannot avoid, welcome.
What you do not wish upon yourself, extend not to others.
What you don’t see, you don’t desire.
When anger arises, think of the consequences.
When economy goes south, people get political.
When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don’t adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
When the waters drop, the rocks appear.
When the winds of change blows, some people build walls and others build windmills.
When you believe in them [Kuei and Shen], they exist. When you do not believe in them, they do not exist.
When you converse, let it be with the wise; when you give food, let it be to the hungry.
When you want to test the depths of a stream, don’t use both feet.
While you are bargaining, conceal your coin.
Who is the greatest liar? Who talks most of himself.
Whoever undertakes a task cannot repudiate the responsibility.
Why so anxiously and busily manage so many evil matters? Drop them all and become a good man.
With a helmsman [i.e. leader] that is not nervous, the passengers [i.e. followers] [will feel] secure.
With true friends… even water drunk together is sweet enough.
With virtue you can’t be completely poor; without it you can’t be truly rich.
Without sorrows no one becomes a saint.
Worship the gods as if they were present; if you don’t worship them, they are but pieces of mud.
You can’t talk of the ocean to a well-frog.
You may deceive people. You cannot deceive Heaven.
"After you" is good manners.
love at first sight. It’s generally used for people, but you can also use it for other physical objects.
A journey of a thousand miles begin with a single step.
A wise man makes his own decisions. An ignorant man follows public opinion.
One generation plants the trees, and another gets the shade.
Your teacher can open the door, but you must enter by yourself.
If you don’t want anyone to know it, don’t do it
It’s better to light a candle than curse the darkness.
Give a man a fish, and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish, and you feed him for a lifetime.
Deep doubts, deep wisdom; small doubts, small wisdom.
[Even] with half of the Lun Yu [put into use], the country can be [well] ruled.
‘Tis foolish to seek/want credit for your ancestor’s achievements.
A wolf will still be a wolf even if he hasn’t eaten your sheep.
The crook will turn into a mule — that the honest man will ride.
When three men march together, one of them must be the boss.
It is difficult to catch a black cat in a dark room, especially when it is not there.
It’s as difficult to be rich without bragging as it is to be poor without complaining.
To know how to do it is simple, the difficulty is in doing it.
Don’t ask in this life for the three most difficult things: good sons, long life and a long beard.
He, who cannot suffer discomfort, will not be called for important things.
If you want your children to enjoy a quiet life let them suffer a little hunger and a little cold.
The main thing is that we can smile at our duties — yes even at our suffering.
The only thing that was missing at the rich man’s funeral was mourners.
He who does not feed the dog feeds the thief.
Draw the bow but don’t shoot — it is a bigger threat to be intimidated than to be hit.
He, who takes revenge for a small insult, will have a bigger one thrown at him.
Happiness has its roots — sorrow has its womb.
If you have never done anything evil, you should not be worrying about devils knocking at your door.
Paper can’t wrap up a fire.
The tongue can paint what the eye can’t see.
The flowers in your garden don’t smell as sweet as those in the wild, but they last much longer.
With money you can make the dead speak; without it you can’t even keep the deaf quiet.
No man is a good doctor who has never been sick himself.
A family in harmony will prosper in everything.
It is easy to govern a kingdom but difficult to rule one’s family.
A family with an old person has a living treasure of gold.
Thatch your roof before rainy weather; dig your well before you become parched with thirst.
Patience is power; with time and patience the mulberry becomes silk.
Don’t expect from others what you can’t promise them yourself.
You can’t expect both ends of a sugar cane to be as sweet.
You cannot fill your belly by painting pictures of bread.
How can you expect to find ivory in a dog’s mouth?.
A clever person turns great troubles into little ones and little ones into none at all.
Distance tests a horse’s strength; time reveals a marls character.
Don’t promise something when you are full of joy; don’t answer letters when you are full of anger.
In the midst of great joy, do not promise anyone anything. In the midst of great anger, do not answer anyone’s letter.
He who hurries cannot walk with dignity.
The key to success isn’t much good until one discovers the right lock to put it in.
If you wish to succeed, consult three old people.
A woman that always laughs is everybody’s wife; a man that is always laughing is an idiot.
There are only two ways to reach the truth — with literature and agriculture.
Never does a woman lie in a more cunning way than when she tells the truth to someone who doesn’t believe her.
Teachers open the door, but you must enter by yourself.
Misfortune only comes in when the door is open.
I dreamed a thousand new paths. I woke and walked my old one.
The path of duty lies in what is nearby, but men look for it in things far off.
To talk goodness is not good… only to do it is.
There are two perfectly good men; one dead, and the other unborn.
He, who knows his heart mistrusts his eyes.
Happy is the man who knows he’s happy.
He, who knows himself knows everybody.

If there is righteousness in the heart, there will be beauty in character. If there is beauty in character, there will be harmony in the home. If there is harmony in the home, there will be order in the nation. If there is order in the nation, there will.
If you can’t change your fate, change your attitude.
Life itself cannot give you joy, unless you really will it. Life just gives you time and space — It’s up to you to fill it.
Often one finds one’s destiny just where one hides to avoid it.
One’s shadow grows larger than life when admired by the light of the moon.
If we do not change our direction, we are likely to end up where we are headed.
A good client doesn’t change shop in three years, a good shop doesn’t change clients in three years.
To forget one’s ancestors is to be a brook without a source, a tree without a root.
A man who cannot tolerate small ills can never accomplish great things.
What is earned with hard labor is eaten with pleasure.
If you want to know your past, look into your present conditions. If you want to know your future — look into your present actions.
Talk doesn’t cook rice.
There is a time to fish and a time to prepare the fish.
He who always eats the roots of a plant is capable of anything.
The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
Even the highest towers begin at the ground.
The brave person regards dying as going home.
Be not a jack of all trades, but a master of one.
Easy to believe in heaven’s law, but so hard to keep.
Easy to know men’s faces, not their hearts.
The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The next best time is now.
Don’t climb a tree to catch a fish.
A bird can roost but on one branch. A mouse can drink no more than its fill from a river.
No matter how tall the mountain, it cannot block out the sun.
Enough shovels of earth — a mountain. Enough pails of water — a river.
Careless rat chewing on a cat’s tail: beware lightning!.
It’s not that the well is too deep, but rather the rope is too short.
Life begins the day you start a garden.
You can’t look at the stars while you are walking if you have a stone in your shoe.
Enough shovels of earth – a mountain. Enough pails of water – a river.
What is lighter than a feather? The wind! Lighter than the wind? The spirit! Lighter than the spirit? The woman! Lighter than the woman? Nothing at all!
Water can do without fish, fish cannot do without water.
Govern a family as you would cook a small fish — very gently.
Donkey’s lips don’t fit onto a horse’s mouth.
The day your horse dies and your money’s gone, your relatives change into strangers.
Good people get cheated, just as good horses get ridden.
The crow does not roost with the phoenix.
Don’t let the falcon loose until you see the hare.
People live like birds in a wood: When the time comes, each takes flight.
It’s better for people to wait for rice, than rice for people.
If you are standing upright, don’t worry if your shadow is crooked. If you want an audience, start a fight.
Don’t use oiled paper to wrap up fire.
Never boast — you might meet someone who knew you as a child.
Locks cannot be made from good iron; soldiers are not made out of good people.
The more souls the more gossip.
Good behavior is a virtue for the man — bad behavior is the virtue of a woman.
With virtue you can’t be entirely poor; without virtue you can’t really be rich.
A vacant mind is open to all suggestions, as a hollow building echoes all sounds.
Gifts reflect those who give them.
Don’t look back when you are walking along the edge of a wall.
Big chickens don’t peck at small seeds.
Before thirty, men seek disease; after thirty, diseases seek men.
A wise man makes his own decisions; an ignorant man follows the public opinion.
Unread books make hollow minds.
If you wish to know what most occupies a man’s thoughts, you have only to listen to his conversation.
Look for a thing until you find it and you’ll not lose your labor.
The one who understands does not speak; the one who speaks does not understand.
Be modest in speech, but excel in action.
Those who do not study are only cattle dressed up in men’s clothes.
When testing the depths of a stream, don’t use both feet.
A bad man talks about what he has eaten and drunk — a good man about what he has seen and heard.
When you are very angry, don’t go to a lawyer; when you are very hungry, don’t be a poet.
The pine stays green in winter, wisdom in hardship.
Where there’s a will to condemn there is also evidence.
Couples who love each other tell each other a thousand things without talking.
Wine lets secrets out.
Man cannot stir one inch without the push of heaven’s finger.
The spirit goes on foot.
A single conversation across the table with a wise man is worth a month’s study of books.
Even the best needles are not sharp at both ends.
Gold cannot be pure, and people cannot be perfect.
Justice is the result of public opinion.
Win a cat and lose a cow — the consequence of litigation.
The man who says it cannot be done should not interrupt a man who is doing it.
The wise man doesn’t say what he does but he never does what can’t be said.
Talking doesn’t get your rice cooked.
The day your horse dies and your money’s lost, your relatives change to strangers.
You think you’ve lost yor horse? Who knows, he may bring a whole herd back to you someday.
There’s many a good man to be found under a shabby hat.
Those who play the game do not see as clearly as those who atch.
Looking for fish? Don’t climb a tree.
Seeking fish? Don’t dive in the pond; go home and get a net.
Of all the thirty-six alternatives, running away is best.
You can’t buy an inch of time with an inch of gold.
Life just gives you time and space — It’s up to you to fill it.
Be not afraid of going slowly; be afraid only of standing still.
If you would be happy for a month, kill a pig; but if you would be happy all your life, plant a garden.
Don’t try to make predictions — especially those concerning the future.
The loss of one night’s sleep is followed by ten days of inconvenience.
If you want happiness for an hour — take a nap. If you want happiness for a day — go fishing.
Pleasure for one year a marriage; but pleasure for a lifetime, a garden.
It’s better to die two years early than to live one year too long.
If you want happiness for a year — inherit a fortune. If you want happiness for a lifetime — help someone else.
Don’t build a new ship out of old wood.
You can’t load a small boat with heavy cargo.
When traveling do not calculate the distance, at dinner don’t think of how much.
When one sheep leads the way all the rest follow.
The poor can only guess at what wealth is; the rich don’t know what poverty means.
When you go to buy, don’t show your silver.
Your fingers can’t be of the same length.
Borrowed money shortens time; working for others lengthens it.
Lend money to someone who won’t pay you back and he’ll hate you.
Those who earn a lot are seldom tired; those who get tired seldom earn a lot.
The happiness in your pocket, don’t spend it all.
He that is not eager to be paid in cash is not a businessman.
Buyers are never as smart as the sellers.
To open a shop is easy — the hard part is keeping it open.
If there are many buyers in the market, the merchant doesn’t wash his turnips.
Don’t buy someone else’s problems.
It is foolish for someone to seek credit for his ancestor’s achievements.
The main thing is that we can smile at our duties , even at our suffering.
Don’t trust your wife until she has borne you ten sons.
Avoid defeat and you will avoid success
One moment’s error becomes a lifetime of sadness.
He, who has never been cheated, cannot be a good businessman.
If you don’t want to be cheated, ask the price at three shops.
He who hasn’t a penny sees bargains everywhere.
A man combs his hair every morning — why not his heart?
Yesterday, today and tomorrow — these are the three days of man.
Don’t open a shop unless you like to smile.
God cannot help those who do not seize opportunities.
Cheap To talk goodness is not good… only to do it is.
In the midst of great joy, do not promise anyone anything. In the midst of great anger, do not answer anyone ‘s letter.
One throws up the dust the other gets it in his eye.
Practice no vice because it’s trivial; neglect no virtue because it’s so.
Drunkenness does not itselfcause bad qualities but it does show them up clearly.
To pretend to satisfy one’s desires with worldly goods is like using straw to put out a fire.
If Heaven made him — earth can find some use for him.
In every family’s cooking pot is one black spot.
Govern a family as you would cook a small fish, very gently.
The guest who outstays his fellow-guests loses his overcoat.
If there is light in the soul, there will be beauty in the person. If there is beauty in the person, there will be harmony in the house.
You can chop a man’s head off, but you can’t keep him quiet.
To understand your parents’ love you must raise children yourself.
It’s not the beauty of a woman that blinds the man, the man blinds himself.
A young woman with an old man is really someone else’s woman.
It’s better to do good in the neighborhood than to burn incense far away.
All people are your relatives; therefore expect only trouble from them.
When you are poor, neighbors close by will not come; once you become rich, you’ll be surprised by visits from relatives afar.
It is better to save your innocence at the expense of your honor than your country at the expense of your life.
A heart that is rotten — breath that smells.
Love is an eye that doesn’t see anything.
Practice no vice because it’s trivial; neglect no virtue becasue it’s so.
As the scream of the eagle is heard when she has passed over, so a man’s name remains after his death.
a boaster and a liar are cousins-german.
Diligence is a treasure of inestimable price, and prudence is the pledge of security.
No pains, no gains.
The early bird catches the worm.
chinese.description: Similar to our previous proverb about doing things at the beginning of the day, this proverb explains that a person who takes action sooner rather than later will benefit from doing so.

chinese.text: If you are planning for one year, grow rice. If you are planning for 20 years grow trees. If you are planning for centuries, grow men.
In learning, age and youth go for nothing; the best informed takes the precedence.
Reform a gambler. Cure leprosy.
Attack is the best defense.
There are plenty of men in the world but very few heroes.
Reshape one’s foot to try to fit into a new shoe.
Time flies like an arrow; days and months like a weaver’s shuttle.
With money, a dragon — without it, a worm.
It is easy to convince a wise man, but to reason with a fool is a difficult undertaking.
A faithful friend is hard to find.
A weasel comes to say Happy New Year to the chickens.
A hundred "no’s" are less painful than one insincere "yes.
Catch one’s heart, never be apart.
A rat who gnaws at a cat’s tail invites destruction.
In security, do not forget danger; in times of public tranquility, be prepared against anarchy.
A friend in need is a friend indeed.
chinese.description: If someone helps you when you have problems, or you are in trouble, that person is a true friend.

chinese.text: Forget the favors given; remember those received
An oppressed army fighting with desperate courage is sure to win.
If you love your son, be liberal in punishment; if you hate your son, accustom him to dainties.
You can’t fill your belly painting pictures of bread.
He who wishes to know the road through the mountains, must ask those who have already trodden it.
The man who does not learn is like one walking in the night.
Guilin’s mountain and water scenery is the best under heaven.
A good fame is better than a good face.
Mistakes occur through haste, never through doing a thing leisurely.
Look before you leap.
chinese.description: Make decisions carefully. Think about it first.

chinese.text: The old tree grows as it was bent when young.
actions speak louder than words.
chinese.description: Be a man of your word, people trust what they see, not what they hear. People will judge you by your actions, be careful of talking too much, people will expect you to follow up.

chinese.text: Do not tear down the east wall to repair the west.
He who advances may fight, but he who retreats may take care of himself.
A man is never too old to learn.
chinese.description: No matter how old you are you should learn new things.

chinese.text: Knowledge is boundless, but the capacity of one man is limited.
If I keep a green bough in my heart, the singing bird will come.
It is as impossible to find a perfect man as it is to find 100 percent pure gold.
a bird in the hand is worth than two in the bush.
A man is as ignorant of his own failings as the ox is unconscious of his great strength.
A good teacher. . . better than a barrowful of books
If a man’s wishes be few, his health will be flourishing; if he has many anxious thoughts, his constitution will decay.
In enacting laws, rigor is indispensable; in executing them, mercy.
To be human is easy; to be a human being is difficult.
If you want dinner, don’t insult the cook.
An ambassador bears no blame
By a long journey we know a horse’s strength; so length of days shows a man’s heart.
adversity makes a man wise, not rich.
Good pupils are to be brought up by strict teachers.
Man perishes in the pursuit of wealth; as the bird meets with destruction in search of its food.
Regular feet can’t be affected by irregular shoes.
If you do not study hard when young you’ll end up bewailing your failures as you grow up.
Distant water won’t quench your immediate thirst.
Practice what you preach.
chinese.description: If you say that everyone needs to arrive on time, make sure that you also arrive on time.

chinese.text: Deep down all men are alike — and that is the problem.
First come, first served.
A merry heart makes a cheerful countenance.
If the first words fail, ten thousand will then not avail.
Honest scales and full measure hurt no one.
He who can suppress a moment’s anger may prevent many days sorrow.
It is better to believe that a man does possess good qualities, than to assert that he does not.
Adversity is necessary to the development of men.
Love me ,love my dog.
Don’t strike a flea on a tiger’s head.
When the water falls the stone becomes visible.
In bed be wife and husband, in the hall each other’s honored guest
Flowing water never goes dirty; our door hubs never gather termites.
A single spark can start a prairie fire.
It takes ten years to grow trees but a hundred years to rear people.
Knowing what is right without practicing it denotes a want of proper resolution.
Disaster emanates from a careless talk.
Don’t let your tongue or your paintbrush wag your tail when they are making up an inventory.
Don’t hang your conscience on your back.
Quiet thoughts mend the body.
Flies never visit an egg that has no crack.
Where ignorance is bliss, it’s folly to be wise.
chinese.description: “Ignorance” is when you don’t know or are unaware of something. “Bliss” is pure joy and happiness. So sometimes it feels better and you’re more comfortable when you don’t know about certain things.

chinese.text: As it is impossible to please men in all things, our only care should be to satisfy our own consciences.
If there be no faith in our words, of what use are they?
He who strikes the first blow admits he’s lost the argument.
Every cloud has a silver lining.
chinese.description: People say this when things are going badly or when someone is sad. Clouds stand for bad situations. Every bad situation has some good parts to it—you just have to look for them. The proverb is meant to help people feel better and keep going. It’s also where the name of the movie “Silver Linings Playbook” came from.

chinese.text: With justice on your side, you can go anywhere; without it, you can’t take a step.
Modesty is attended with profit; arrogance brings on destruction.
When you are in Rome, do as the Romans do.
chinese.description: When you are a visitor somewhere away from home, you should act like everyone else. It is polite to do so, and could keep you from getting into trouble. This proverb is from the ancient days of the Roman Empire when the capital city had visitors from all over the world. Cultures were very different between cities in those times. But while in Rome, one would behave like a Roman, no matter where you came from.

chinese.text: At the gambling table, there are no fathers and sons.
The fangs of the green snake and the sting of a wasp don’t really make poison — that is only to be found in a woman’s heart.
If you share a man’s wealth, try to lessen his misfortune.
A light heart lives long.
a man can do no more than he can.
Where there is life, there is hope.
Past events are as clear as a mirror; the future, as obscure as varnish.
Don’t waste your hour–the sun sets soon
The fool does what he can’t avoid, the wise man avoids what he can’t do.
Nothing is too deceitful in war.
Dismantle the bridge shortly after crossing it.
When children travel far from home, mothers never stop worrying.
The man of worth is really great, without being proud; the mean man is proud, without being really great.
He who at once knows himself, and knows others, will triumph as often as he contends.
Eat your three meals in the day, and look forward to sleeping at night.
Have one’s ears pierced only before the wedding ceremony starts.
Don’t draw a sword against a louse.
a bad workman always blames his tools.
chinese.description: This proverb is used when talking about someone who blames the bad job that he has done on the tools he has been using, when in reality, the job was done badly by him. For example, if a doctor had given a patient the wrong diagnosis, he might say that it was because his stethoscope had malfunctioned when really he simply hadn’t taken the time to examine the patient properly and therefore had made the error himself.

chinese.text: Just one laugh makes the person ten years younger.
a good medicine tastes bitter.
It’s not the fleas of the dog that make the cat meow.
Learn from past mistakes to avoid future ones.
To correct an evil which already exists is not so well as to foresee and prevent it.
Inattention to minute actions will ultimately be prejudicial to a man’s virtue.
There is only one pretty child in the world and every mother has it.
A dog won’t forsake his master because of his poverty; a son never deserts his mother for her homely appearance.
He who knows himself knows everybody.
Man is born without knowledge, and when he has obtained it, very soon becomes old; when his experience is ripe, death suddenly seizes him.
A smile can erase a million worries.
Let us get drunk today, while we have wine; the sorrows of tomorrow may be borne tomorrow.
If a rat wants to die it bites a cat’s tail.
A single hair of silk does not make a thread; one tree does not make a grove.
Do not anxiously expect what is not yet come; do not vainly regret what is already past.
A friend — one soul, two bodies.
A vicious wife, and an untoward son, no laws can govern.
Honors come by diligence; riches spring from economy.
Nothing can be accomplished without norms or standards.
Be not disturbed at being misunderstood; be disturbed at not understanding.
No horse can wear two saddles .
A day’s planning is done in the morning.
A word spoken can never be taken back.
He knows most who speaks least.
It is better to travel ten thousand miles than to read ten thousand books.
A man combs his hair every morning , why not his heart?
You always win by not saying the things you don’t have to say.
A camel standing amidst a flock of sheep.
When you are very hungry, don’t be a poet.
Whatever satisfies hunger is good food.
No melon peddler cries, "Bitter melons." No wine dealer says, "Sour wine.
The more you eat, the less flavor; the less you eat, the more flavor.
Not wine, men intoxicate themselves; not vice, men entice themselves.
Wine does not intoxicate a man — a man intoxicates himself.
Water is the mother of tea, a teapot its father, and fire the teacher.
A true warrior, like tea, shows his strength in hot water.
Drinking a daily cup of tea will surely starve the apothecary.
The best cure for drunkenness is whilst sober to observe a drunken person.
One monk shoulders water by himself; two can still share the labor among them. When it comes to three, they have to go thirsty.
Even the most resourceful housewife cannot create miracles from rice less pantry.
Learn to handle a writing-brush and you’ll never handle a begging – bowl.
The happiest life ends before death.
Life is a dream walking, death is going home.
One never needs their humor as much a when they argue with a fool.
A clever person turns great troubles into little ones, and little ones into none at all.
All people are your relatives, therefore expect only trouble from them.
He who covers up his mistakes intends to make some more.
Mistakes occur through haste, never through doing a thing leisurely.
Always leave a little room for a mistake.
You never are so easily mistaken as when you think you know the way.
Three glasses of wine end a hundred quarrels.
If cooks quarrel, the roast burns.
An answer that does not resolve a quarrel makes a thousand new ones.
A wise man adapts himself to circumstances, as water shapes itself to the vessel that contains it.
For each man produced by heaven, earth provides a grave.
A young doctor makes a full graveyard.
The earth offers you a grave everywhere.
Get the coffin ready and watch the man mend.
He who seeks revenge should remember to dig two graves.
Great doubts deep wisdom. Small doubts little wisdom.
It is a sad situation for a son-in-law when his mother-in-law praises him.
When a king makes a mistake, all the people suffer.
In a group of many words, there is bound to be a mistake somewhere in them.
All the past died yesterday; the future is born today.
If you are not so strong, don’t carry heavy burdens.
In a house where there are many beautiful daughters the soup kettle will never get polished.
You won’t see a good drunk in a teahouse.
Failure is mother of success.
Great promises are not followed by corresponding actions.
The cure of ignorance is study, as meat is that of hunger.
Don’t try to make predictions , especially those concerning the future.
Fear the wolf in front and the tiger behind, hesitate in doing something.
Do well and have well.
A person leaves a reputation, bad or good, behind wherever he works or stays.
In our actions, we should accord with the will of heaven; in our words, we should consult the feelings of men.
Every man has his hobbyhorse.
If you do without something for long enough, then you don’t need it.
Never try to prove what nobody doubts.
A thousand-li journey is started by taking the first step.
What is told into a man’s ear is often heard a hundred miles away.
Climb the mountains to see lowlands
Tell me and I’ll forget; show me and I may remember; involve me and I’ll understand.
Doubt and distraction are on earth; the brightness of truth in heaven.
He who tells me of my faults, is my instructor; he who tells me of my virtues, does me harm.
Blame yourself as you blame others; forgive others as you forgive yourself
Every step leaves its print; work steadily and make solid progress.
If your words are worthless, don’t give advice.

If there is righteousness in the heart, there will be beauty in character. If there is beauty in character, there will be harmony in the home. If there is harmony in the home, there will be order in the nation. If there is order in the nation, there will
It is hard to please everyone.
If you want happiness for an hour; take a nap. If you want happiness for a day; go fishing. If you want happiness for a month; get married. If you want happiness for a year; inherit a fortune.
What is wrong for the powerless is wrong for the powerful.
Covet wealth, and want it; don’t, and luck will grant it.
If a man does not receive guests at home, he will meet with very few hosts abroad.
No one is more afraid of ghosts than those who don’t believe in them.
Prudence will carry a man all over the world; but the impetuous find every step difficult.
Once on a tiger’s back, it is hard to alight.
One never needs their humor as much a when they argue with a fool.
He who loves peace, minds his own business.
Able people can do more.
You forgive everything of someone who doesn’t forgive himself.
He who takes medicine and neglects to diet wastes the skill of his doctors.
A dog won’t forsake his master because of poverty; a son never deserts his mother because of her homely appearance.
A dog in a kennel barks at his fleas — a hunting dog does not feel them.
How can you expect to find ivory in a dog’s mouth?
You don’t need a dog to catch a lame hare.
If you are not a fish, how can you know if the fish are happy?
In the midst of great joy do not promise to give a man anything; in the midst of great anger do not answer a man’s letter.
Life itself cannot give you joy, unless you really will it. Life just gives you time and space; it’s up to you to fill it.
One joy scatters a hundred grieve.
When the water fall the stone becomes visible.
